Mendagri Tito Karnavian akan Libatkan Ibu-ibu PKK Cegah Stunting
02 Nov 2019, 00:24 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Menteri Dalam Negeri (Mendagri) Tito Karnavian mendorong upaya pencegahan stunting di Indonesia. Tito mengatakan, Kemendagri akan melibatkan ibu-ibu PKK hingga pihak terkait untuk mencegah stunting.
"Kita bekerjasama dengan Kementerian/Lembaga di tingkat Pusat untuk membuat program-program prioritas daerah mana yang perlu ada perhatian terlebih dahulu atau prioritas utamanya secara bertahap, dan kemudian kita akan libatkan jaringan dari organisasi terutama jaringan ibu-ibu, relawan, untuk bersama mengampanyekan stunting dengan program-program kreatif untuk stunting ini," ujar Tito dalam keterangan tertulis dari Kemendagri, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Hal ini disampaikan Tito seusai menghadiri rapat di Kantor Wakil Presiden, Jl Medan Merdeka Utara, Jakarta Pusat. Menurutnya, kampanye dengan melibatkan jaringan-jaringan di masyarakat tersebut sangat penting dilakukan untuk memberikan pemahaman yang lebih menyeluruh tentang permasalahan stunting dan pencegahannya.
"Kampanye penting, karena belum tentu masyarakat paham, termasuk kepala daerah yang tidak paham apa itu arti stunting. Kalau tidak paham, bagaimana mau masuk APBD, mau buat terobosannya seperti apa, termasuk mengintegrasikan bantuan-bantuan sosial berupa pangan maupun non pangan. Ini akan kita lakukan di bawah arahan Bapak Wakil Presiden dan juga kita akan bergerak sambil nanti evaluasi," kata mantan Kapolri ini.
Untuk itu, Tito meminta program-program terkait pengentasan kemiskinan dan stunting harus masuk ke dalam Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Daerah (APBD).
"Bahwa program-program pengentasan kemiskinan dan stunting harus masuk di dalam APBD, ini harus diyakinkan. Jadi nanti kita akan libatkan network (jaringan) yang ada di Kemendagri, yaitu dari Inspektorat dan Dirjen Bina Keuangan Daerah yang akan melihat apakah sudah masuk programnya. Kalau sudah masuk data, kita akan yakinkan betul daerah-daerah yang perlu dapat prioritas intervensi stunting," ujar Tito.

(dkp/aik)

Minister of Home Affairs Tito Karnavian will Involve PKK Women to Prevent Stunting
02 Nov 2019, 00:24 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Minister of the Interior (Mendagri) Tito Karnavian encourages efforts to prevent stunting in Indonesia. Tito said that the Ministry of Home Affairs would involve PKK mothers and related parties to prevent stunting.
"We are working together with Ministries / Institutions at the central level to make regional priority programs which need to be addressed first or the main priorities gradually, and then we will involve the network of organizations, especially networks of mothers, volunteers, to jointly campaign for stunting with creative programs for this stunting, "said Tito in a written statement from the Ministry of Home Affairs, Friday (1/11/2019).
This was conveyed by Tito after attending a meeting at the Vice President's Office, Jl Medan Merdeka Utara, Central Jakarta. According to him, the campaign by involving networks in the community is very important to be carried out to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the problem of stunting and prevention.
"Campaigns are important, because people do not necessarily understand, including regional heads who do not understand what stunting means. If you do not understand, how to enter the APBD, what kind of breakthroughs you want, including integrating social assistance in the form of food and non-food. This will we do it under the direction of Mr. Vice President and also we will move while evaluating later, "said the former National Police Chief.
For this reason, Tito asked that programs related to poverty alleviation and stunting should be included in the Regional Budget (APBD).
"That poverty alleviation and stunting programs must be included in the APBD, this must be convinced. So later we will involve the network in the Ministry of Home Affairs, namely from the Inspectorate and the Director General of Regional Financial Development who will see whether the program has entered. "We have entered the data, we will make sure that the areas that need priority in stunting intervention," said Tito.
